thread.title: Ex-cop suspect in Maguindanao massacre injured in shootout
thread.title_full: Ex-cop suspect in Maguindanao massacre injured in shootout

title: Ex-cop suspect in Maguindanao massacre injured in shootout
text:
By: Edwin Fernandez , Williamor Magbanua - @inquirerdotnet Inquirer Mindanao / 08:39 AM March 02, 2017 
KIDAPAWAN CITY, Cotabato—A former police officer wanted for his alleged involvement in the 2009 Maguindanao massacre was injured in a shootout with lawmen, who were out to arrest him in Pikit, North Cotabato on Tuesday, the police confirmed Thursday. 
Chief Inspector Donald Cabigas, the Pikit town police chief, said the local police were to serve the arrest warrant issued by Judge Jocelyn Solis Reyes of RTC-221 in Quezon City against former PO1 Jonathan Engid for the death of over 50 people, 32 of them journalists, in Ampatuan town in November 2009 when he resisted and opened fire on approaching lawmen. 
Cabigas said Engid was critically injured and rushed by police to the North Cotabato provincial hospital. ADVERTISEMENT 
Engid was the 122nd suspect charged before RTC-122 for the involvement in the country’s worst election related violence that claimed 58 lives. 
More than 70 other suspects remained at large to this day. 
Cabigas said the suspect is under close watch by a team of police while he remained in the hospital.
